channel.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:59, topic:422384”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=525054.msg3955698#msg3955698 date=1332724839]

I think a quick fix to all of the item problems would be to cache the items based upon their widget id to a table and then do checks when necessary. I’m interested in what cheats can be preformed on clients so if you have any interesting ones that you don’t think have been posted on this thread, post em.

Banking, trading, magic on item. Magic on item might not be checked.

Structure:

Short The items slot ID.
Short Special A The item ID.
Short The frame ID.
Short Special A The spell ID.[/quote]

What base are you talking about? Should prob check Delta, PI has it all patched.[/quote]
I was just throwing packets I know of out there. I highly doubt that magic on item is actually checked for say, high alchemy (on some bases).

Read full topic

Structure:

[quote]
Short The items slot ID.

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:54, topic:422384”]Like, checking of the item at all times, if you’re not checking for any item to be there then you can basically manipulate the system.

If you still don’t understand, have t4 or someone other than myself attempt to explain it to you.[/quote]

But all you would send is say, Slot7 and slot4. You don’t tell the server exactly what items are there, just what slots you’re trying to use. If the server DOESN’T check what items are there, the system is entirely flawed and nothing will happen. So obviously if the server has Item on item added, there is a checking system for it involved.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:53, topic:422384”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=525054.msg3955605#msg3955605 date=1332718475]
Depends is the server has proper server-sided checking of the item.
[/quote]
If you’re replying to mine… What do you mean?
It just sends slots. If you send two slots, the server obviously has to check what item is there. If it doesn’t then nothing will happen. There’s no way to corrupt that system[/quote]
I’ve tried multiple packets on PI, but of course Sanity was nice enough to patch it. It send the slots of the items, then the server checks if the player has those items in the players list/array.

		int usedWithSlot = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWord();
		int itemUsedSlot = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordA();
		int useWith = c.playerItems[usedWithSlot] - 1;
		int itemUsed = c.playerItems[itemUsedSlot] - 1;
		UseItem.ItemonItem(c, itemUsed, useWith);

You still could send items that are not there, but that will just throw an exception server-sided; won’t do much harm.

I’ve tampered with multiple packet sending client-sided, but only got so far as to throw an exception server-sided using the move item packet.

Read full topic

Depends is the server has proper server-sided checking of the item.

If you’re replying to mine… What do you mean?
It just sends slots. If you send two slots, the server obviously has to check what item is there. If it doesn’t then nothing will happen. There’s no way to corrupt that system

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

How is it possible to use Item on item for this? The wiki says the packet is organized like so:
Short The item being used on’s slot.
Short Special A The item being used’s slot.

It isn’t possible to fake IDs then right?

Read full topic

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:41, topic:422384”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=525054.msg3830276#msg3830276 date=1322516082]
Sigh.

if(inputString.startsWith("::pickup")) { String[] args = inputString.subString(0, "::pickup").split(" "); PacketManager instance = new PacketManager(this.stream); instance.pickupItem(Integer.parseInt(args[0]), Integer.parseInt(args[1]), Integer.parseInt(args[2])); }
??? Can’t substring a string.
[/quote]
“::pickup”.length(), wrote the snipped as I was replying.[/quote]
Learn the String class by heart. gosh noobz.

item.title: Cheat clients mini-lecture
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“ppshnt, post:38, topic:422384”][quote author=t4 link=topic=525054.msg3830106#msg3830106 date=1322503599]

first of all i’d like to say thanks, i managed to fully login with your stream files, but now my problem is that whenever i try a command thats from my packet manager i get a null pointer

Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.NullPointerException at PacketManager.dropItem(PacketManager.java:19) at RunClient.actionPerformed(RunClient.java:249)

line 19 being

and 249

the null pointer error is a bit longer, i only included these 2 lines because i thought they were the main problem

is the stream instance the correct one/is it initialized?
[/quote]

Well, im using the packetmanager file you posted on the OP. Is there anything wrong with it or is there a certain way i should initialize the stream?

[/quote]
Sigh.

private void method73()
	{
		do
		{
			int j = readChar(-796);
			if(j == -1)
				break;
			if(openInterfaceID != -1 && openInterfaceID == reportAbuseInterfaceID)
			{
				if(j == 8 && reportAbuseInput.length() > 0)
					reportAbuseInput = reportAbuseInput.substring(0, reportAbuseInput.length() - 1);
				if((j >= 97 && j <= 122 || j >= 65 && j <= 90 || j >= 48 && j <= 57 || j == 32) && reportAbuseInput.length() < 12)
					reportAbuseInput += (char)j;
			} else
			if(messagePromptRaised)
			{
				if(j >= 32 && j <= 122 && promptInput.length() < 80)
				{
					promptInput += (char)j;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 8 && promptInput.length() > 0)
				{
					promptInput = promptInput.substring(0, promptInput.length() - 1);
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 13 || j == 10)
				{
					messagePromptRaised = false;
					inputTaken = true;
					if(friendsListAction == 1)
					{
						long l = TextClass.longForName(promptInput);
						addFriend(l);
					}
					if(friendsListAction == 2 && friendsCount > 0)
					{
						long l1 = TextClass.longForName(promptInput);
						delFriend(l1);
					}
					if(friendsListAction == 3 && promptInput.length() > 0)
					{
						stream.createFrame(126);
						stream.writeWordBigEndian(0);
						int k = stream.currentOffset;
						stream.writeQWord(aLong953);
						TextInput.method526(promptInput, stream);
						stream.writeBytes(stream.currentOffset - k);
						promptInput = TextInput.processText(promptInput);
						promptInput = Censor.doCensor(promptInput);
						pushMessage(promptInput, 6, TextClass.fixName(TextClass.nameForLong(aLong953)));
						if(privateChatMode == 2)
						{
							privateChatMode = 1;
							aBoolean1233 = true;
							stream.createFrame(95);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(publicChatMode);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(privateChatMode);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(tradeMode);
						}
					}
					if(friendsListAction == 4 && ignoreCount < 100)
					{
						long l2 = TextClass.longForName(promptInput);
						addIgnore(l2);
					}
					if(friendsListAction == 5 && ignoreCount > 0)
					{
						long l3 = TextClass.longForName(promptInput);
						delIgnore(l3);
					}
				}
			} else
			if(inputDialogState == 1)
			{
				if(j >= 48 && j <= 57 && amountOrNameInput.length() < 10)
				{
					amountOrNameInput += (char)j;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 8 && amountOrNameInput.length() > 0)
				{
					amountOrNameInput = amountOrNameInput.substring(0, amountOrNameInput.length() - 1);
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 13 || j == 10)
				{
					if(amountOrNameInput.length() > 0)
					{
						int i1 = 0;
						try
						{
							i1 = Integer.parseInt(amountOrNameInput);
						}
						catch(Exception _ex) { }
						stream.createFrame(208);
						stream.writeDWord(i1);
					}
					inputDialogState = 0;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
			} else
			if(inputDialogState == 2)
			{
				if(j >= 32 && j <= 122 && amountOrNameInput.length() < 12)
				{
					amountOrNameInput += (char)j;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 8 && amountOrNameInput.length() > 0)
				{
					amountOrNameInput = amountOrNameInput.substring(0, amountOrNameInput.length() - 1);
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 13 || j == 10)
				{
					if(amountOrNameInput.length() > 0)
					{
						stream.createFrame(60);
						stream.writeQWord(TextClass.longForName(amountOrNameInput));
					}
					inputDialogState = 0;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
			} else
			if(backDialogID == -1)
			{
				if(j >= 32 && j <= 122 && inputString.length() < 80)
				{
					inputString += (char)j;
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if(j == 8 && inputString.length() > 0)
				{
					inputString = inputString.substring(0, inputString.length() - 1);
					inputTaken = true;
				}
				if((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0)
				{
					if(myPrivilege == 2)
					{
					  if(inputString.equals("::clientdrop"))
							dropClient();
						if(inputString.equals("::lag"))
							printDebug();
						if(inputString.equals("::prefetchmusic"))
						{
							for(int j1 = 0; j1 < onDemandFetcher.getVersionCount(2); j1++)
								onDemandFetcher.method563((byte)1, 2, j1);

						}
						if(inputString.equals("::fpson"))
							fpsOn = true;
						if(inputString.equals("::fpsoff"))
							fpsOn = false;
						if(inputString.equals("::noclip"))
						{
							for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)
							{
								for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++)
								{
									for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
										aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

								}

							}

						}
					}

//TODO: THIS IS WHERE YOUR TEXT FROM THE CHATBOX IS PARSED SO IF YOU WANT METHODS TRIGGED BY TEXT COMMANDS, ADD THEM HERE (EXAMPLE)


					/* if(inputString.startsWith("::pickup")) {
					      String[] args = inputString.subString(0, "::pickup").split(" ");
					      PacketManager instance = new PacketManager(this.stream);
					      instance.pickupItem(Integer.parseInt(args[0]), Integer.parseInt(args[1]), Integer.parseInt(args[2]));
					   }*/


					if(inputString.startsWith("::"))
					{
						stream.createFrame(103);
						stream.writeWordBigEndian(inputString.length() - 1);
						stream.writeString(inputString.substring(2));
					} else
					{
						String s = inputString.toLowerCase();	
						int j2 = 0;
						if(s.startsWith("yellow:"))
						{
							j2 = 0;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("red:"))
						{
							j2 = 1;
							inputString = inputString.substring(4);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("green:"))
						{
							j2 = 2;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("cyan:"))
						{
							j2 = 3;
							inputString = inputString.substring(5);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("purple:"))
						{
							j2 = 4;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("white:"))
						{
							j2 = 5;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("flash1:"))
						{
							j2 = 6;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("flash2:"))
						{
							j2 = 7;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("flash3:"))
						{
							j2 = 8;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("glow1:"))
						{
							j2 = 9;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("glow2:"))
						{
							j2 = 10;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("glow3:"))
						{
							j2 = 11;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						}
						s = inputString.toLowerCase();
						int i3 = 0;
						if(s.startsWith("wave:"))
						{
							i3 = 1;
							inputString = inputString.substring(5);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("wave2:"))
						{
							i3 = 2;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("shake:"))
						{
							i3 = 3;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("scroll:"))
						{
							i3 = 4;
							inputString = inputString.substring(7);
						} else
						if(s.startsWith("slide:"))
						{
							i3 = 5;
							inputString = inputString.substring(6);
						}
						stream.createFrame(4);
						stream.writeWordBigEndian(0);
						int j3 = stream.currentOffset;
						stream.method425(i3);
						stream.method425(j2);
						aStream_834.currentOffset = 0;
						TextInput.method526(inputString, aStream_834);
						stream.method441(0, aStream_834.buffer, aStream_834.currentOffset);
						stream.writeBytes(stream.currentOffset - j3);
						inputString = TextInput.processText(inputString);
						inputString = Censor.doCensor(inputString);
						myPlayer.textSpoken = inputString;
						myPlayer.anInt1513 = j2;
						myPlayer.anInt1531 = i3;
						myPlayer.textCycle = 150;
						if(myPrivilege == 2)
							pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr2@" + myPlayer.name);
						else
						if(myPrivilege == 1)
							pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr1@" + myPlayer.name);
						else
							pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, myPlayer.name);
						if(publicChatMode == 2)
						{
							publicChatMode = 3;
							aBoolean1233 = true;
							stream.createFrame(95);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(publicChatMode);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(privateChatMode);
							stream.writeWordBigEndian(tradeMode);
						}
					}
					inputString = "";
					inputTaken = true;
				}
			}
		} while(true);
	}

Read full topic
